author: Kelly Crow
title: New Signs of Confidence in the Art Market
text:
Art collectors appear to be entering their Confident Period.
Reassured by a string of strong prices paid last year for high-end art—like that $450 million Leonardo da Vinci—collectors seem increasingly willing to pry their masterpieces off their walls and put them on the auction block. Half the offerings in Christie’s Tuesday sale of impressionist and modern art in London have never been to auction before, a sign that sellers expect to reap tidy profits selling pieces they’ve held on to for years, or even decades.
